oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Balm for the Weary and the Wounded"
Quintard Prayer Book "Balm for the Weary and Wounded"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Interior cover bears dedication "with warmest regards" to Mrs. A. O. Harris from C.T. Quintard.

After the death of Bishop James H. Otey in 1863, Doctor C.T. Quintard became the second Episcopal Bishop of Tennessee. During the Civil War, he served as a chaplain with an elite group of Confederate soldiers, the Rock City Guards, which was organized from Nashville and the surrounding area. This book was printed in Columbia, South Carolina, apparently to be issued to Confederate soldiers. According to tradition, a copy was found in the jacket of Leonidas Polk after his death at Pine Mountain, Georgia, on June 4, 1864. After the war, Quintard was appointed Vice-Chancellor of the University of the South, Sewanee, Tennessee.
